name: Avalanche
author: CrusaderDroid
desc:
Numerous rocks descend on an area with a radius between 40 to 60 feet, chosen by you. Creatures in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take 12d10 bludgeoning damage and are buried underneath the rocks. On a success, they take half damage and are restrained until the end of their next turn.

Buried creatures are restrained and heavily obscured, and can take no actions except actions that only affect themselves, as well as making a Strength saving throw for 2 AP. A creature that succeeds on the first Strength saving throw is no longer heavily obscured and can take other actions again. A creature that succeeds on the second Strength saving throw is no longer restrained.

The rocks remain and cause the area to be difficult terrain.
